[{'created': '2020-10-14 10:29:20.000000000', 'message': 'Performance: skip LVM configuration if no groups configured

Currently we import the manage-lvm role with a condition that skips
tasks when no LVM groups are configured. At large scale this is
inefficient.

This change improves the performance for hosts where there are no LVM
groups configured, by using include_role rather than a static import.

Story: 2007993
Task: 40664

Change-Id: Ib51ac445cc787d7045d72a9ecec14434d432d9e7
(cherry picked from commit 5ff5e6b10011875d1c29d16a8b39498adc0145e0)
'}]
commit_message:
Performance: skip LVM configuration if no groups configured

Currently we import the manage-lvm role with a condition that skips
tasks when no LVM groups are configured. At large scale this is
inefficient.

This change improves the performance for hosts where there are no LVM
groups configured, by using include_role rather than a static import.

Story: 2007993
Task: 40664

Change-Id: Ib51ac445cc787d7045d72a9ecec14434d432d9e7
(cherry picked from commit 5ff5e6b10011875d1c29d16a8b39498adc0145e0)

subject: Feature to manage public endpoints via DNS names
messages:
[{'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2020-10-13 12:26:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2020-10-13 12:27:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-10-13 12:33:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

To me this seems to be adding considerable complication that could be implemented by just overriding the <service>_fqdn and port variables.'}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2020-10-13 12:40:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> To me this seems to be adding considerable complication that could
 > be implemented by just overriding the <service>_fqdn and port
 > variables.

But, by doing that, somebody would need to maintain the config for all of the services (the overriding of the FQDN).  Also, not all services are using FQDN overrides as we can see in the change set. 

With this feature, it is only a matter of configuring the base DNS name. Moreover, the port, for some systems, is the same for internal, admin, and public. Therefore, it is not that easy to generate these DNS names. It would require overriding all of the public URLs. And again, maintaining all of them, which looks troublesome.

This is a process that we started with that huge patch to normalize the use of endpoints. I am breaking things now to avoid so much trouble as we had before. That is why I am only proposing the public endpoints management so far.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-10-13 13:24:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I've added this to the agenda for tomorrow's IRC meeting."}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2020-10-13 17:09:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2020-10-14 11:14:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-13 12:26:37.000000000', 'message': "Feature to manage public endpoints DNS names

As a follow up of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652157/,
this patch introduces a mechanism for operators to register public
endpoints using a DNS name generated on the fly based on a domain name
configured and the component/service name.

This facilitated facilitates the `override` of public (external) URLs with the
following standard: '<component/serviceName>.<companyBaseUrl>'. This allows
operators to easily and automatically create more friendly URLs.
E.g. keystone.<endpoints_base_domain_name>

By default, we will keep using the IP address + service port. Therefore, this
feature is only activated when `endpoints_base_domain_name` is set to some
base domain name such as `xyz.com`.

This implementation is not introducing the HAproxy (or some other web
proxy) configuration to execute the balance and fowarding of requests
based on DNS names. Therefore, the operator would have to set it up.
To reduce the scope, we introduce here the configuration of the public
endpoints URLs using DNS names. After this one, the next steps is to
(i) handle the internal URLs names, and then, (ii) HAproxy + (iii)some
other system to handle health checks of systems properly.

Change-Id: I1275fb01f8c4b15cad3c26fcd7b562fbc866c21c
"}, {'created': '2020-10-13 12:27:12.000000000', 'message': "Feature to manage public endpoints via DNS names

other system to handle health checks of systems properly.

Change-Id: I1275fb01f8c4b15cad3c26fcd7b562fbc866c21c
"}, {'created': '2020-10-13 17:09:29.000000000', 'message': "Feature to manage public endpoints via DNS names

commit_message:
Feature to manage public endpoints via DNS names

As a follow up of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652157/,
this patch introduces a mechanism for operators to register public
endpoints using a DNS name generated on the fly based on a domain name
configured and the component/service name.

This facilitates the `override` of public (external) URLs with the
following standard: '<component/serviceName>.<companyBaseUrl>'. This allows
operators to easily and automatically create more friendly URLs.
E.g. keystone.<endpoints_base_domain_name>

By default, we will keep using the IP address + service port. Therefore, this
feature is only activated when `endpoints_base_domain_name` is set to some
base domain name such as `xyz.com`.

This implementation is not introducing the HAproxy (or some other web
proxy) configuration to execute the balance and fowarding of requests
based on DNS names. Therefore, the operator would have to set it up.
To reduce the scope, we introduce here the configuration of the public
endpoints URLs using DNS names. After this one, the next steps is to
(i) handle the internal URLs names, and then, (ii) HAproxy + (iii)some
other system to handle health checks of systems properly.

Change-Id: I1275fb01f8c4b15cad3c26fcd7b562fbc866c21c

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: Ia49d466231fc0a56ccd4eed5a95bb749936e9950
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Bump the pyflakes to 2.1.1 as min version to run pep8 jobs
on py3.8 which is default python vesion in ubuntu focal.

Bump cassandra-driver to 3.21.0 in lower-constraints.txt
since it is the min version with py3.8 support [2]

Bump kazoo to 2.8.0 in lower-constraints.txt
since it is the min version with py3.8 support [3]

Story: #2007865
Task: #40197

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal.html
[2] https://pypi.org/project/cassandra-driver/3.21.0/
[3] https://github.com/python-zk/kazoo/commit/6b6ffe62a073d1ed5413c65c2d8ec94ea2fa1760

Change-Id: I3a465aa0b26dd72432696d2dd19c955eb3e974e5
(cherry picked from commit 6b60c25db1cc0ef1202d65ff77b40875ca96dfda)

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

-Bump the requirements and lower constraints for required deps
which added python3.8 support in their later version.

-It also fixes one unit tests to handle PEP479 being enabled for all code
in Python 3.8 [2].

Story: #2007865
Task: #40197

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal.html
[2] https://stackoverflow.com/questions/51700960/runtimeerror-generator-raised-stopiteration-every-time-i-try-to-run-app

Change-Id: If67bbfe8a2db19fa8f3437f746ca7f4d04487447
(cherry picked from commit e8a953ba3a8d606fc9bc98c44ab4c36073d9cd32)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-13 21:34:12.000000000', 'message': '[Python3] Fix python3 bugs in code

- The BaseException class no longer has a "message"
  attribute in python 3 [1]. On the contrary, the
  string representation of an Exception object will
  print all the exception args in all supported
  python versions, so use that instead.
- Functional tests were run with a specific locale,
  remove those annotations so we can handle unicode
  encoding and decoding in python3 envs.
- Cleanup errors were not being handled correctly,
  cleanup the code so we don't have spurious failures.
- In python3, dict.keys() gives you a view for lazy
  loading, so convert occurrences to lists as expected
  in our functional tests.
- Start capturing STDOUT and STDERR in tox envs to
  enable troubleshooting.

Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1811627
Closes-Bug: #1811516
Change-Id: Idaa2fb9b60451b3fbd298e19574195f2d663c6f4
[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0352/#transition-plan
(cherry picked from commit b955ac9064b15d00e8966dda745814c146c8af01)
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit c0ce858da632355404906b6b05ee8de232a1b6fa)

commit_message:
[Python3] Fix python3 bugs in code

- The BaseException class no longer has a "message"
  attribute in python 3 [1]. On the contrary, the
  string representation of an Exception object will
  print all the exception args in all supported
  python versions, so use that instead.
- Functional tests were run with a specific locale,
  remove those annotations so we can handle unicode
  encoding and decoding in python3 envs.
- Cleanup errors were not being handled correctly,
  cleanup the code so we don't have spurious failures.
- In python3, dict.keys() gives you a view for lazy
  loading, so convert occurrences to lists as expected
  in our functional tests.
- Start capturing STDOUT and STDERR in tox envs to
  enable troubleshooting.

Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1811627
Closes-Bug: #1811516
Change-Id: Idaa2fb9b60451b3fbd298e19574195f2d663c6f4
[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0352/#transition-plan
(cherry picked from commit b955ac9064b15d00e8966dda745814c146c8af01)
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit c0ce858da632355404906b6b05ee8de232a1b6fa)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-12 18:39:53.000000000', 'message': 'Migrate functional job to native zuulv3

The manilaclient functional test job
"manilaclient-dsvm-neutron-functional"
is currently broken due to a change to its
parent job in the devstack repository.

Instead of investing to fix that legacy style
job, we'd be better off rewriting it to be
in native zuulv3 style, i.e., without the
use of the deprecated devstack-gate project.

- Introduce a new job "python-manilaclient-functional"
  which replaces "manilaclient-dsvm-neutron-functional"
  but preserves the testing done by the latter.
- The new job runs on a minimal devstack (keystone,
  neutron, manila, mysql and rabbit) and uses an ansible
  role introduced to setup test configuration.
- Add a "bindep.txt" file to call out test system
  dependencies, and install them via the new job.
- Cleanup the old job, the associated devstack gate
  hooks and playbooks.

Change-Id: I3b67f3b566bdadf1cc228f885b7253435a4507b5
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit d65d7f05a7f99aad7b3a4ba286c8ab136775d303)
(cherry picked from commit f852358f21c04a551e40d397e00577fbb90aa534)

commit_message:
Migrate functional job to native zuulv3

The manilaclient functional test job
"manilaclient-dsvm-neutron-functional"
is currently broken due to a change to its
parent job in the devstack repository.

Instead of investing to fix that legacy style
job, we'd be better off rewriting it to be
in native zuulv3 style, i.e., without the
use of the deprecated devstack-gate project.

- Introduce a new job "python-manilaclient-functional"
  which replaces "manilaclient-dsvm-neutron-functional"
  but preserves the testing done by the latter.
- The new job runs on a minimal devstack (keystone,
  neutron, manila, mysql and rabbit) and uses an ansible
  role introduced to setup test configuration.
- Add a "bindep.txt" file to call out test system
  dependencies, and install them via the new job.
- Cleanup the old job, the associated devstack gate
  hooks and playbooks.
  
This commit also removes two non-voting rally jobs from this
branch. We do not commit to rally testing on extended maintenance
branches, where we intend to commit only critical-serious
or security bugs where possible, performing best case
testing

Change-Id: I3b67f3b566bdadf1cc228f885b7253435a4507b5
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit d65d7f05a7f99aad7b3a4ba286c8ab136775d303)
(cherry picked from commit f852358f21c04a551e40d397e00577fbb90aa534)
(cherry picked from commit cf01e725dfdccd37631c30400cb72d95ff275ecb)
(cherry picked from commit 771700bd513ec0c34225976b85835eafab7eb7b6)
(cherry picked from commit 1ca51195c3500c54fdc2de5845a4ed7dc8016ae8)

commit_message:
libvirt: Log exception when unable to import rbd or rados

This should help provide some context when the RbdDriver later raises a
RuntimeError if rbd or rados hasn't been imported correctly.

Change-Id: Ie8bb5e5622bd37dfe8073cca12f77174e8e7d98c

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate kuryr-tempest-plugin jobs to focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Most of the Tempest jobs will be migrate automatically once devstack
base job start running on Focal(Depends-On).

Stable jobs testing stable branch needs to keep running on their supported
distro version which is bionic from stein till ussuri.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal.html

Change-Id: I2fec67b388d6823e3cc5e1eb84c197485bb08d04
Story: #2007865

commit_message:
Performance: optimize genconfig

Config plays do not need to check containers. This avoids skipping
tasks during the genconfig action.

Ironic and Glance rolling upgrades are handled specially.

Swift and Bifrost do not use the handlers at all.

Partially-Implements: blueprint performance-improvements
Change-Id: I140bf71d62e8f0932c96270d1f08940a5ba4542a
(cherry picked from commit 3411b9e4201e619613cef427d228cf00f310a144)

commit_message:
Add new classes ovs_driver and sriov_driver

Those classes handles ML2 plugin's configuration related to the
OVS and SR-IOV mechanism drivers.
Previously there was neutron::plugins::ml2::mech_driver function which
was used by neutron::plugins::ml2 class but it isn't used at all
currently and probably it will need to be deprecated and removed in
follow up patch(es).

Change-Id: I2a321fb780e789b7556d557e2170a3267049c432
(cherry picked from commit 0b8a90ec5c4cdac145672150ee4d58f7959cf6bb)

See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547733/4/ as an example'}, {'account_id': 26311, 'date': '2018-06-14 01:49:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

There are "add tag" and "set tags" two methods, and use "server set" command to add tags

 > > i think we want to leverage the `server set` and `server unset`
 > > commands to add and remove tags. the same way we do with

There are "server-tag-set" and "server-tag-add" two methods, if I use "--tags", which method should be used, "--tags"and "--tag"?'}, {'account_id': 26311, 'date': '2018-06-28 11:38:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 26311, 'date': '2018-06-29 03:25:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-06-29 07:50:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Code-Review-1

You should modify openstackclient/tests/unit/compute/v2/test_server.py, add tag parameter in listserver.'}, {'account_id': 26311, 'date': '2018-06-29 09:49:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 26311, 'date': '2018-06-29 11:59:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 22.'}, {'account_id': 26311, 'date': '2018-06-29 12:09:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 23.'}, {'account_id': 26311, 'date': '2018-07-02 01:38:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 24.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-07-23 21:45:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 24: Code-Review-1

The command structures are a bit inconsistent.  add/remove commands relate two distinct resources with each other, these commands do not do that, 'tag' is not a top-level resource, it is a server property.  They should be dealt with as server properties in the create/set/unset commands.

Look at how tags are handled in the network commands.  If server tags are different than that then we need to sort it out because users expect things named the same to behave the same.

Also, update the docs when it is finalized."}, {'account_id': 26311, 'date': '2018-07-27 08:35:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 25.'}, {'account_id': 26311, 'date': '2018-07-30 09:27:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 26.'}, {'account_id': 26311, 'date': '2018-07-30 09:29:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

 > not do that, 'tag' is not a top-level resource, it is a server
 > property.  They should be dealt with as server properties in the
 > create/set/unset commands.
 > 
 > Look at how tags are handled in the network commands.  If server
 > tags are different than that then we need to sort it out because
 > users expect things named the same to behave the same.
 > 
 > Also, update the docs when it is finalized.
Done"}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-08-07 15:18:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

recheck gate fixed'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-08-14 16:03:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Sigh.  We are inconsistent in the use of --tag / --tags in OSC.  The Network commands have been touched to use --tags in places where --tag should have been used.  I think here the create and set commands need to use --tag to match how --property works elsewhere, I am on the fence about list --tags due to the other three related options.'}, {'account_id': 26311, 'date': '2018-08-15 11:04:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

commit_message:
Revert VMware deprecation

Nova has reversed their deprecation of the VMware driver, and the Kolla
community has shown an interest in it.

rally: Add rally-openstack

Currently source builds and centos-binary builds do not install
rally-openstack. It results in errors with finding openstack plugin.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-13 12:26:26.000000000', 'message': '[goal] Migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

-Bump the lower constraints for required deps which added python3.8 support
in their later version.

-Changing the way to install and configure Zookeeper.
Installing Zookeeper from official Apache's tarball.
Adding the possiblity to set the specific Zookeeper version.
Minor change in zookeeper logger.

-Use mariadb JDBC for monasca-thresh in devstack, since Drizzle isn't
compatible with MySql Server v8.0.x which is default in Focal

-Python 3.8 doesn't seem to like dictionary keys changing during
iteration.

Fixing RuntimeError: dictionary keys changed during iteration.

Tech. details:
It runs well in py27: 5 iterations
It runs risky in py37: 7 iterations
It is forbbiden in py38: raised RuntimeError
Fixed with list(dic.items()) or tuple(dic.items())

dic = {'1': 'a', '2': 'b', '3': 'c', '4': 'd', '5': 'e'}
for key, value in dic.items():
    print("Key: {0} Value: {1}".format(key,value))
    del dic[key]
    print(dic)
    dic[key] = value
print(dic)

Story: #2007865
Task: #40197
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/756859
Change-Id: Ieb4cf38038ffb4d1a152f8ab3b64a14098c7cbb3
(cherry picked from commit 43922f822319a526299b6c8ca80f51f5b388a87e)
'}]
commit_message:
[goal] Migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

-Bump the lower constraints for required deps which added python3.8 support
in their later version.

-Changing the way to install and configure Zookeeper.
Installing Zookeeper from official Apache's tarball.
Adding the possiblity to set the specific Zookeeper version.
Minor change in zookeeper logger.

-Use mariadb JDBC for monasca-thresh in devstack, since Drizzle isn't
compatible with MySql Server v8.0.x which is default in Focal

-Python 3.8 doesn't seem to like dictionary keys changing during
iteration.

Fixing RuntimeError: dictionary keys changed during iteration.

Tech. details:
It runs well in py27: 5 iterations
It runs risky in py37: 7 iterations
It is forbbiden in py38: raised RuntimeError
Fixed with list(dic.items()) or tuple(dic.items())

dic = {'1': 'a', '2': 'b', '3': 'c', '4': 'd', '5': 'e'}
for key, value in dic.items():
    print("Key: {0} Value: {1}".format(key,value))
    del dic[key]
    print(dic)
    dic[key] = value
print(dic)

Story: #2007865
Task: #40197
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/756859
Change-Id: Ieb4cf38038ffb4d1a152f8ab3b64a14098c7cbb3
(cherry picked from commit 43922f822319a526299b6c8ca80f51f5b388a87e)

commit_message:
corrects  Kubernetes Services handlers

The handlers that need to be enabled to correctly handle
Kubernetes Services events are (endpoints,service,kuryrloadbalancer)
and not (lb,lbaasspec) as placed in most of the docs.
This was due to the recent movement to KuryrLoadBalancer custom
resources definitions (CRD).

Change-Id: I0eff3b68839a659d39650e2cb22956e30d2c7332
Closes-Bug: #1899013

'}, {'created': '2020-10-13 21:13:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix failures in Docker storage driver check

In some environments the can_talk_to_docker key is missing from the
result of docker_host_info when the call succeeds. Assume we can talk to
Docker if this key is not present, instead of failing due to a missing
attribute error.

Change-Id: I7670410394b0bb5fc96e4166b6a20714f847250b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix failures in Docker storage driver check

In some environments the can_talk_to_docker key is missing from the
result of docker_host_info when the call succeeds. Assume we can talk to
Docker if this key is not present, instead of failing due to a missing
attribute error.

Change-Id: I7670410394b0bb5fc96e4166b6a20714f847250b

commit_message:
Add a hacking rule for assert_has_calls

Add the following hacking rule.

* N366: The assert_has_calls is a method rather than a variable.

  Not correct: mock_method.assert_has_calls = [mock.call(0)]
  Correct:     mock_method.assert_has_calls([mock.call(0)])

This patch is a follow-up patch for
Id094dd90efde09b9a835d4492f4a92b8f8ad296e.

Change-Id: I892f8c23ee44f2b3518776a9705e3543f3115cae
Signed-off-by: Takashi Natsume <takanattie@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2020-10-12 15:39:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pool delete race on load balancer cascade delete

In what appears to be a race condition, load balancer cascade delete can
fail while deleting numerous pools. The load balancer can still be
deleted with one or more follow-up cascade delete API calls but this is
suboptimal.

Per local testing, the ValueError exception is harmless so we can just
ignore it and continue the pool delete flow, with no orphan resources
left behind resulting from the exception skip.

Change-Id: I9283d9804feb83a1d5a160da48da6146b19da88c
Task: 41096

commit_message:
Fix pool delete race on load balancer cascade delete

In what appears to be a race condition, load balancer cascade delete can
fail while deleting numerous pools. The load balancer can still be
deleted with one or more follow-up cascade delete API calls but this is
suboptimal.

Per local testing, the ValueError exception is harmless so we can just
ignore it and continue the pool delete flow, with no orphan resources
left behind resulting from the exception skip.

Task: 41096
Story: 2008249

Change-Id: I9283d9804feb83a1d5a160da48da6146b19da88c

commit_message:
Fix doc reference builds

The api reference was broken some time around the stein release.

Moved conf options out of setup.cfg and into the doc conf.py, and added
an option to doc build to error on warnings so this doesn't happen
again without anyone noticing. The format is now similar to the
novaclient reference doc.

Change-Id: Ic9ed059521794acf1ac1a644096fdc10549fa91b

[{'created': '2020-10-14 08:26:03.000000000', 'message': "Add ssl_verify_client

This adds the ssl_verify_client parameter that
is passed down to the apache::vhost resource.

Without this being set, as of puppetlabs-apache 2.1.0,
the horizon_ca parameter will be ignored and you won't
get the CA/intermediate set in the vhost configuration. [1]

This was introduced a long long time ago which means we should
backport this or SSL is semi-broken when using this module.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-apache/blob/2.1.0/CHANGELOG.md#changed

Change-Id: I9f60f266400a6d0ccfad757aa33009929c02cde7

commit_message:
Add ssl_verify_client

This adds the ssl_verify_client parameter that
is passed down to the apache::vhost resource.

Without this being set, as of puppetlabs-apache 2.1.0,
the horizon_ca parameter will be ignored and you won't
get the CA/intermediate set in the vhost configuration. [1]

This was introduced a long long time ago which means we should
backport this or SSL is semi-broken when using this module.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-apache/blob/2.1.0/CHANGELOG.md#changed

Change-Id: I9f60f266400a6d0ccfad757aa33009929c02cde7

commit_message:
Add Octavia OVN Provider configuration (1 of 2)

This patch enhances Octavia's OVN driver config, so it can connect to
OVN_Northbound DB using TLS.

This is part 1 of 2, where octavia::api::ovn_nb_connection will move
to newly created octavia::provider::ovn::ovn_nb_connection config file.
But that has to be split into 2 parts to avoid breaking the
CI until the THT+pupple-tripleo changes merges [1].

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:bug/1861886+(status:open+OR+status:merged)

Co-Authored-By: Brent Eagles <beagles@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1861886
Change-Id: Id74ef39ff303c9abf8118df203970cd871ed974a
(cherry picked from commit dce599e49898d7973805a389d3abf5048f9f5099)

If a custom CA file is configured via nova_ca_certificates_file,

Change-Id: I54a4f398a06c61e0f6f8f3efd3e4b6214bca756b

commit_message:
Fix CA file for nova client

If a custom CA file is configured via nova_ca_certificates_file,
currently communication with Keystone will fail, since the session is
not created using this CA file. The same is true for nova_api_insecure.

This change fixes the issue by using a keystoneauth session loader.

Closes-Bug: #1873736

Change-Id: I54a4f398a06c61e0f6f8f3efd3e4b6214bca756b
(cherry picked from commit 3bd82c776c91bdd1caee474f3fc9cda18927da7f)
(cherry picked from commit fc7546a2aed061f661fc4e975343f32a6fdc27d8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-03 15:32:44.000000000', 'message': '[NetApp] Fix access rules for CIFS promoted replica

This patch fixes the access rules for NetApp promote replica when
using CIFS protocol. When promoting a replica, the NetApp ONTAP
driver updates the access rules for the promoted CIFS share entity
before actually creating it, failing on having those rules
applied.

The bug is fixed by switching the order of updating the access
and creating the promoted CIFS share entity.

Change-Id: I60e4057dc962d96cff57dea88587a28c2043b499
Closes-Bug: #1896949
'}]
commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix access rules for CIFS promoted replica

This patch fixes the access rules for NetApp promote replica when
using CIFS protocol. When promoting a replica, the NetApp ONTAP
driver updates the access rules for the promoted CIFS share entity
before actually creating it, failing on having those rules
applied.

The bug is fixed by switching the order of updating the access
and creating the promoted CIFS share entity.

Change-Id: I60e4057dc962d96cff57dea88587a28c2043b499
Closes-Bug: #1896949

commit_message:
Add mariadb-connector-j and bump version to 2.4.0

mariadb-connector-j is:

- Well maintained.
- Compatible (v2.7.0) with MySql Server 8.0.x
- LGPL Licensed

Change-Id: I44830b47a1de4ae69f635327a2da1802a67d92d2
Story: 2008236
Task: 41079

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: Ic34248eb20a264e9037a6fd0060cc511d4a22037
Sem-Ver: feature

VMware: populate datastore refs at init

This will save a cache populate at run time.

I've no idea how I'd test this, but the logic seems fine and the logs are clear so...why not?"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2020-03-30 13:53:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> I've no idea how I'd test this, but the logic seems fine and the
 > logs are clear so...why not?

Just an idea, but you can configure the size of the pool so do something like sync_power_state_pool_size=2, stub out some method that gets called within the sync block, submit a sync on an instance and assert your stub method gets hit (and make it blocking), then submit another sync and assert it's not processed because the first sync is still in a blocking method. Then release the first and assert the sync on the second is unblocked."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2020-03-30 13:53:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> so...why not?

Because screwing around with thread pools can be dangerous if not understood and not tested.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2020-04-15 10:44:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Workflow-1

to be honest, I am with matt here, the more you look at this, the more problems I see. You could easily argue the current approach is good, as it makes sure you get through all the instances, I could see you failing to make progress here (although it might look nicer for a bit)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-04-16 10:46:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-10-14 12:22:54.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Following the documentation:

invoked due to an exception and this specific instance
would never have its state synced.

commit_message:
Prevent compute manager freeze when greenpool is full

Prior to spawning a process for the power sync we make sure
that there is a free pool. If there is no free pool then the
next spawn_n will block until there is a free pool.

Following the documentation:
http://eventlet.net/doc/modules/greenpool.html

Change-Id: Idd9edc60d9e17ea8e4f4c87bf0d61e55edb79591
Closes-bug: #1776621

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Bump the pyflakes to 2.1.1 as min version to run pep8 jobs
on py3.8 which is default python vesion in ubuntu focal.

Bump cassandra-driver to 3.21.0 in lower-constraints.txt
since it is the min version with py3.8 support [2]

Bump kazoo to 2.8.0 in lower-constraints.txt
since it is the min version with py3.8 support [3]

Story: #2007865
Task: #40197

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal.html
[2] https://pypi.org/project/cassandra-driver/3.21.0/
[3] https://github.com/python-zk/kazoo/commit/6b6ffe62a073d1ed5413c65c2d8ec94ea2fa1760

Change-Id: I3a465aa0b26dd72432696d2dd19c955eb3e974e5

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

-Bump the requirements and lower constraints for required deps
which added python3.8 support in their later version.

-It also fixes one unit tests to handle PEP479 being enabled for all code
in Python 3.8 [2].

Story: #2007865
Task: #40197

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal.html
[2] https://stackoverflow.com/questions/51700960/runtimeerror-generator-raised-stopiteration-every-time-i-try-to-run-app

Change-Id: If67bbfe8a2db19fa8f3437f746ca7f4d04487447

commit_message:
Add Python3 Wallaby unit tests

This change ensures unit testing is in place for all of the tested
runtimes for Wallaby.

See also the Project Testing Interface (PTI) in OpenStack Governance.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: Idd2d1e2eda761d6aa53fc463b97853cb6ea45827

commit_message:
Update ovn-octavia-provider contacts

Maciej no longer works on Openstack, so remove him, and add
Flavio Fernandes as a replacement.  Also added contact into
to the neutron-teams page.

Change-Id: I2f43a389644afcfa5a42571b6c5c093fd21560f1

commit_message:
[OVN][Doc] DevStack guide: Add command to get the  port's UUID

It just makes it simpler for the user to copy & paste a command to
obtain the port's UUID.

Change-Id: Ib839c8ed1e78f14d49690367a68f007a68c5cebe
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-02 10:43:34.000000000', 'message': '[WIP: do not merge] Add new port_forwarding tests

Extend set of tests for the port_forwarding feature to automate coverage
of specific cases:

  - Port forwaring on neutron ports with multiple fixed ips
  - Out of range values for port
  - Forward communication to multiple fixed IPs of a particular Neutron port
  - Editing and Deleting UDP port forwarding rule

Change-Id: I0fbf0a12c050a5a7184c96b62eee32139bc820b4

commit_message:
Add more port_forwarding tests

Extend set of tests for the port_forwarding feature to automate coverage
of specific cases:

  - Port forwaring on neutron ports with multiple fixed ips
  - Out of range values for port
  - Forward communication to multiple fixed IPs of a particular Neutron port
  - Editing and Deleting UDP port forwarding rule

Related-Bug: #1897753
Change-Id: I0fbf0a12c050a5a7184c96b62eee32139bc820b4

commit_message:
Add API check for server_groups.create

The policies field has been replaced with the
policy field since Nova API version 2.64[1]

This commit adds a check to make sure the correct field is used.

[1]https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id59

Change-Id: I06d3211937d822c26070b7f8ad757c365dcbb1bb
Story: #2007822
Task: #40101
(cherry picked from commit 51a1ea65f4d095b073381200e5268f909bf360de)

commit_message:
Add API check for server_groups.list

The policies parameter has been replaced with the
policy parameter since Nova API version 2.64[1]

This commit adds a check to make sure the correct parameter is used.

[1]https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id59

Change-Id: Ia37beb7790884d6d15bec45074f446e64af1a2aa
Story: #2008041
Task: #40703
(cherry picked from commit ed6d8d941104c60f447de852582eb9388b9d2e73)

[{'created': '2020-10-09 14:28:13.000000000', 'message': "Log the ports we bind in flat

While trying to troubelshoot the standalone job's rescue
failures, I noticed we didn't log the VIF port ID of the
port we use for rescue. Which makes it far more difficult
to backtrack and try and figure out where things went sideways.

So it seems clear we should log the ports we succeed at binding,
and thus the flat driver now keeps a quick list of ports bound
and will log that as a result.

Change-Id: Id66e5398ee3a1e1630262a229ee6c706b7e62a08
"}]
commit_message:
Log the ports we bind in flat

While trying to troubelshoot the standalone job's rescue
failures, I noticed we didn't log the VIF port ID of the
port we use for rescue. Which makes it far more difficult
to backtrack and try and figure out where things went sideways.

So it seems clear we should log the ports we succeed at binding,
and thus the flat driver now keeps a quick list of ports bound
and will log that as a result.

Change-Id: Id66e5398ee3a1e1630262a229ee6c706b7e62a08

commit_message:
Performance: skip LVM configuration if no groups configured

Currently we import the manage-lvm role with a condition that skips
tasks when no LVM groups are configured. At large scale this is
inefficient.

This change improves the performance for hosts where there are no LVM
groups configured, by using include_role rather than a static import.

Story: 2007993
Task: 40664

Change-Id: Ib51ac445cc787d7045d72a9ecec14434d432d9e7

[{'created': '2019-05-27 07:16:25.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I4574da8136fa14eb8ae2bf14c26af47974289921

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I4574da8136fa14eb8ae2bf14c26af47974289921
Closes-Bug:  #1801657

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-08 16:49:21.000000000', 'message': 'baremetal: Install iptables for Docker if enabled

If iptables is not installed, e.g. in the CentOS 8 cloud image, and
Docker iptables management is enabled, we get the following errors:

Failed to find iptables: exec: \"iptables\": executable file not found
in $PATH failed to start daemon: Error initializing network controller:
error obtaining controller instance: failed to create NAT chain DOCKER:
Iptables not found

This change installs the iptables package Docker iptables management is
enabled.

Change-Id: I3ba5318debccafb28c3cbce8e4e9813c28b086fc
Closes-Bug: #1899060
'}]
commit_message:
baremetal: Install iptables for Docker if enabled

If iptables is not installed, e.g. in the CentOS 8 cloud image, and
Docker iptables management is enabled, we get the following errors:

Failed to find iptables: exec: \"iptables\": executable file not found
in $PATH failed to start daemon: Error initializing network controller:
error obtaining controller instance: failed to create NAT chain DOCKER:
Iptables not found

This change installs the iptables package Docker iptables management is
enabled.

Change-Id: I3ba5318debccafb28c3cbce8e4e9813c28b086fc
Closes-Bug: #1899060

commit_message:
Restore behavior of image create with same name.

With 60e7c51df4cf061ebbb435a959ad63c7d3a296bf the behaviour of
`openstack image create` changed so that you can't create an image
with the same name. This patch restores the previous functionality.

Story: 2008229
Task: 41069

Change-Id: Ia0f4920371a918e94d1ccf9fcfcbf90ff885a455

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-30 03:21:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I4bf93e866b35bd5c7f584539760ff159a94c532b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I4bf93e866b35bd5c7f584539760ff159a94c532b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-10 12:20:59.000000000', 'message': 'Victoria final releases for cycle-with-rc projects

This tags the final release for all cycle-with-rc projects for Victoria.
While not required, having PTLs ack this patch would be nice to include
that record in the merged metadata.

Release activity should now be frozen until this is processed on Oct 14.
Any bugfixes merged to stable/victoria can be queued up and ready to go
as a follow on stable release after the coordinated release date.

There are different diff-start values for each project. This is used
when generating release notes to denote the point where the
stable/ussuri branch started to diverge from what is included on
stable/victoria. For some, this will be the final Ussuri major version,
but if multiple RCs were done, this may show the initial RC1 release
version. This is normal.

Change-Id: I71d78cf386b960c20f6f453fb13c263d4c9b2e18
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Victoria final releases for cycle-with-rc projects

This tags the final release for all cycle-with-rc projects for Victoria.
While not required, having PTLs ack this patch would be nice to include
that record in the merged metadata.

Release activity should now be frozen until this is processed on Oct 14.
Any bugfixes merged to stable/victoria can be queued up and ready to go
as a follow on stable release after the coordinated release date.

There are different diff-start values for each project. This is used
when generating release notes to denote the point where the
stable/ussuri branch started to diverge from what is included on
stable/victoria. For some, this will be the final Ussuri major version,
but if multiple RCs were done, this may show the initial RC1 release
version. This is normal.

Change-Id: I71d78cf386b960c20f6f453fb13c263d4c9b2e18
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'account_id': 31693, 'date': '2020-03-09 13:49:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-03-09 13:49:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

Workflow Guide: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-03-09 14:01:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-03-09 16:06:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-03-09 20:47:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

the fix is legit but there is one little problem with this - we could be hiding api issue behind if - let's check the return code to verify non-existence instead of treating any failure as non-existence"}, {'account_id': 31693, 'date': '2020-03-10 09:04:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-03-10 09:08:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

needs a bit more bash dance'}, {'account_id': 31693, 'date': '2020-03-10 09:28:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > needs a bit more bash dance

Thanks for your input but I don't see errexit set anywhere in the script. Either way, if it is set could you please explain to me how I should check return code in a sensible way? 

Something like

openstack domain show heat_user_domain && rc=$? || rc=$?

if [[ $rc -eq 1 ]] ...

hurts readability in my opinion.

The redirection of the output to /dev/null could be left out in this case, you're right."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-03-10 10:02:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > (2 comments)
 > >
 > > needs a bit more bash dance
 > 
 > Thanks for your input but I don't see errexit set anywhere in the
 > script. Either way, if it is set could you please explain to me how
 > I should check return code in a sensible way?
 > 
 > Something like
 > 
 > openstack domain show heat_user_domain && rc=$? || rc=$?
 > 
 > if [[ $rc -eq 1 ]] ...
 > 
 > hurts readability in my opinion.
 > 
 > The redirection of the output to /dev/null could be left out in
 > this case, you're right.

This script is sourced by start.sh from base. You can see all deploy jobs failing atm on this change.

You probably want something along

openstack domain show heat_user_domain || {
  if ...
}"}, {'account_id': 31693, 'date': '2020-03-10 10:10:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 31693, 'date': '2020-03-10 10:12:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-03-10 10:28:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-03-10 10:32:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

We also keep talking about moving this to kolla-ansible. We couldn't really backport that though, especially if this is used by Tripleo (not sure)."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-03-10 10:32:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-03-10 10:43:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> (1 comment)

I would be fine with just changing the grep for heat to heat_user_domain if that is ok because it would actually fix our issue with this.

I thought testing openstack domain show heat_user_domain would be better than running grep and awk against the output of openstack domain list but it seems like I was wrong.

So what do you think? Is changing the grep match to heat_user_domain a good solution?'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-03-10 11:54:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> > (1 comment)
 > 
 > I would be fine with just changing the grep for heat to
 > heat_user_domain if that is ok because it would actually fix our
 > issue with this.
 > 
 > I thought testing openstack domain show heat_user_domain would be
 > better than running grep and awk against the output of openstack
 > domain list but it seems like I was wrong.
 > 
 > So what do you think? Is changing the grep match to
 > heat_user_domain a good solution?

The awk command is better as it allows for an exact match of the correct field.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-03-10 11:58:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

subject: Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-14 09:32:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I395c86300f3231f822b12a664d2f426fe2052ec4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I395c86300f3231f822b12a664d2f426fe2052ec4

exception.BadRequest expects string as a 'message' argument, so we can't
pass ValueError without casting it to string.

Change-Id: Iff43c38dca596e694cc7c6bc20e71669d83e31e2
"}]
commit_message:
Fix error handling on instance create

exception.BadRequest expects string as a 'message' argument, so we can't
pass ValueError without casting it to string.

Change-Id: Iff43c38dca596e694cc7c6bc20e71669d83e31e2

commit_message:
Do not pass BOOTIF=None if no BOOTIF can be guessed

It breaks inspection with the default add_ports=pxe.

Change-Id: I730b4bbd48e7188148669670fdb742b88a62f820

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also

commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: Ib84e56ca712d793580ae39f46e9f8e75e4853e58

commit_message:
Bump hacking min version to 3.0.1

hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to avoid bringing in a new
version with new checks.

bumping the min version for hacking so that any older hacking versions
which auto adopt the new checks are not used.

Change-Id: I5bcdb5757051418c2ed1a45f49caeffebea4201c

commit_message:
Add create tags for server

Add API of creating tags for one server by
'openstack server tag create --os-compute-api-version <server> <tag>'.
This command requires ``--os-compute-api-version`` 2.26 or greater.
The <server> is name or ID of one server.
The <tag> is tag(s) to add.
Add unittest for the api.

Change-Id: I09bda6ed5d981a5a62ce3dd73c1c4e5e61093466

In the meantime, a -1 from me shouldn't stop others from reviewing it."}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-03-26 16:25:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

OK, I went through this and took notes. First, the dirty version of my notes:

Current:

A. instance pagesize:
  calls down to can_fit_pagesize(use_free=True) ==> uses available aka not overcommit

B. no instance pagesize:
  host pagesize:
    calls down to can_fit_pagesize(use_free=False) ==> uses total, aka overcommit
  no host pagesize:
    checks total instance cell mem vs total host cell mem ==> overcommit

C. if cpu_pinning_requested:
  calls to _numa_fit_instance_cell_with_pinning, checks avail ==> no overcommit
no cpu pinning:
  if limits:
    checks total with allocation_ratio ==> overcommit
  no limits:
    nothing ???

Proposed:

instance pagesize:
  calls down to can_fit_pagesize(use_free=True) ==> uses available aka not overcommit
no instance pagesize:
  host pagesize:
    if cpu_pinning:
      calls down to can_fit_pagesize(use_free=True) ==> uses free, aka no overcommit
    if no cpu_pinning:
      calls down to can_fit_pagesize(use_free=False) ==> uses total, aka overcommit
  no host pagesize:
    if pinning:
       check avail memory ==> no overcommit
    if no pinning:
       check total memory ==> overcommit
if cpu_pinning_requested:
  calls to _numa_fit_instance_cell_with_pinning, does no memory checks at all
no cpu_pinning:
  if limits:
    checks total with allocation_ratio ==> overcommit
  no limits:
    nothing ???

I've been trying to write in English a summary of the above, but in doing so, I'm realizing that I still don't understand what's the point of this patch. In para B above, when I write "overcommit", I mean that the code checks total memory rather than available. But it only *returns* if the check fails. It means if then proceeds to block C, which then checks for available memory. IOW, any instance with CPU pinning should not overcommit memory.

Having written that, I *think* I'm begging to see the point of this patch. Yes, it checks for available memory, but that doesn't include different page sizes, I guess?

I'll save this comment for now for the record, and come back to this after lunch.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-03-26 16:35:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-03-27 14:35:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-03-27 14:53:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> OK, I went through this and took notes. First, the dirty version of
 > my notes:
 > 
 > Current:
 > 
 > A. instance pagesize:
 > calls down to can_fit_pagesize(use_free=True) ==> uses available
 > aka not overcommit
 > 
 > B. no instance pagesize:
 > host pagesize:
 > calls down to can_fit_pagesize(use_free=False) ==> uses total, aka
 > overcommit
 > no host pagesize:
 > checks total instance cell mem vs total host cell mem ==>
 > overcommit
 > 
 > C. if cpu_pinning_requested:
 > calls to _numa_fit_instance_cell_with_pinning, checks avail ==> no
 > overcommit
 > no cpu pinning:
 > if limits:
 > checks total with allocation_ratio ==> overcommit
 > no limits:
 > nothing ???


This isn't quite correct. At least as it's written, it suggests A, B and C are mutually exclusive. Instead, it looks more like this:

  A. Instance requests pagesize
     No overcommit

  B. Instance does not request pagesize

     1) Host has hugepages

        i. Instance is pinned
           "Overcommit" if there are hugepages on the host

        ii. Instance is not pinned
            No overcommit

     2) Host does not have hugepages

        i. Instance is pinned
           No overcommit  [*]

        ii. Instance is not pinned
           Overcommit

[*] This is enforced in the '_numa_fit_instance_cell_with_pinning' function.

The gap is in B.1.i. We don't distinguish between pinned and unpinned instances here. The same check we hit in B.2.i. is also triggered, but that's doing a simple available memory check. It does not consider memory allocated for hugepages.

[snip]

 > Having written that, I *think* I'm begging to see the point of this
 > patch. Yes, it checks for available memory, but that doesn't
 > include different page sizes, I guess?

Ultimately, we want to get to a situation where hugepages (anything other than 4k pages on x86 hosts) are never considered usable by non-pagesize aware instances. I don't think this fix fully addresses that. It does handle it for pinned instances though since those are the ones most affected by attempting to use memory that isn't actually available.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-03-27 14:55:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-03-27 15:16:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-03-27 15:44:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

(3 comments)

stephen is correct.

also TIL you do @a to reference the left hand diff.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-04-02 14:33:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

We had a chat with Stephen on GMeet because I couldn't wrap my head around this, and here's what came out:

===

Let's start with an example: A host with 1 NUMA cell, 2 CPUs, 1G of 4k pages, and a single 1G page.

Boot a first instance with 1 CPU, CPU pinning, 1G of RAM, and no specific page size. The checks in hardware.py pass (as they should) and the instance boots.

Then boot a second identical instance on the same host. It should not be allowed to boot, because the only memory left is the 1G huge page. However, it boots successfully.

The reason for that is as follows. There are currently 2 memory checks in _numa_fit_instance_cell() that are relevant to our example. The first is a call to can_fit_pagesize(use_free=False), which checks total host pages, regardless if they're free (not used by another instance) or not. This check passes, because the host cell has 1G of 4K pages, enough to fit the instance's 1G of RAM.

The second check is a call to _numa_fit_instance_cell_with_pinning(). Unlike the first check, _numa_fit_instance_cell_with_pinning() does look at only available memory. However, it ignores page size and thus passes, because the host still has that 1G huge page not used by the first instance.

This patch modifies the first check to only check free host pages if the instance is using CPU pinning. As a consequence of this, the second checks becomes redundant and can be removed from _numa_fit_instance_cell_with_pinning(), but because that method is called in situations other than our example, that bit of code has to be re-introduced inline in those places.

===

-1 because I'd like to see a more detailed commit message, something similar to ^^^, otherwise it's looking good. Question inline unrelated to the -1."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-05-25 08:23:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-09-15 15:21:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2020-09-15 16:14:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-15 19:19:44.000000000', 'message': 'Make overcommit check for pinned instance pagesize aware

When working on a fix for bug #1811870, it was noted that the check to
ensure pinned instances do not overcommit was not pagesize aware. This
means if an instance without hugepages boots on a host with a large
number of hugepages allocated, it may not get all of the memory
allocated to it. Move this check to the same place where pagesize-aware
checks are done, resolving the issue.

Change-Id: I74861a67827dda1ab2b8451967f5cf0ae93a4ad3

'}, {'created': '2020-09-15 15:21:05.000000000', 'message': 'Make overcommit check for pinned instance pagesize aware

When working on a fix for bug #1811870, it was noted that the check to
ensure pinned instances do not overcommit was not pagesize aware. This
means if an instance without hugepages boots on a host with a large
number of hugepages allocated, it may not get all of the memory
allocated to it. Put in concrete terms, consider a host with 1 NUMA
cell, 2 CPUs, 1G of 4k pages, and a single 1G page. If you boot a first
instance with 1 CPU, CPU pinning, 1G of RAM, and no specific page size,
the instance should boot successfully. An attempt to boot a second
instance with the same configuration should fail because there is only
the single 1G page available, however, this is not currently the case.
The reason this happens is because we currently have two tests: a first
that checks total (not free!) host pages and a second that checks free
memory but with no consideration for page size. The first check passes
because we have 1G worth of 4K pages configured and the second check
passes because we have the single 1G page.

Close this gap.

Change-Id: I74861a67827dda1ab2b8451967f5cf0ae93a4ad3
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1811886

commit_message:
Make overcommit check for pinned instance pagesize aware

When working on a fix for bug #1811870, it was noted that the check to
ensure pinned instances do not overcommit was not pagesize aware. This
means if an instance without hugepages boots on a host with a large
number of hugepages allocated, it may not get all of the memory
allocated to it. Put in concrete terms, consider a host with 1 NUMA
cell, 2 CPUs, 1G of 4k pages, and a single 1G page. If you boot a first
instance with 1 CPU, CPU pinning, 1G of RAM, and no specific page size,
the instance should boot successfully. An attempt to boot a second
instance with the same configuration should fail because there is only
the single 1G page available, however, this is not currently the case.
The reason this happens is because we currently have two tests: a first
that checks total (not free!) host pages and a second that checks free
memory but with no consideration for page size. The first check passes
because we have 1G worth of 4K pages configured and the second check
passes because we have the single 1G page.

Close this gap.

Change-Id: I74861a67827dda1ab2b8451967f5cf0ae93a4ad3
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1811886

commit_message:
fullstack: Fetch created subnet in loop

In case neutron-server raises BadRequest, try to list subnets for the
given network in the hope that some internal delay causes the issue, but
the subnet creation is ready.

Change-Id: Ie5db7c3c7e182aba07cd6da99c6c70b905f6de47
Closes-Bug: #1893188

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I13304665086ad547307dd46e9ff0d116c70a7783

commit_message:
Define condition for the first play host one time

We use the same condition, which defines against what host some "service"
tasks should run against, several times. It's hard to keep it the same
across the role and ansible spending additional resources to evaluate
it each time, so it's simpler and better for the maintenance to set
a boolean variable which will say for all tasks, that we want to run
only against signle host, if they should run or not now.

Change-Id: I78d44704a0224b2c73832a607e84ea8d9499f8c2

commit_message:
Set up health_manager processes based on worker-multiplier

Properly limit the number of processes with worker-multiplier instead of
spawning as many workers as available CPU threads.

Change-Id: I7f42e131d7de4a58a926b634950969e6f406bb10
Closes-Bug: #1889731

support, but 6.1.0 was in the Train series.

subject: [WIP] Remove VMware integration from kolla-ansible
messages:
[{'account_id': 32067, 'date': '2020-08-20 01:49:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 32067, 'date': '2020-08-20 15:17:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 32067, 'date': '2020-08-20 15:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 32067, 'date': '2020-08-20 15:40:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-08-21 15:16:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

We had some renewed interest in VMWare support, and have not yet decided whether to continue with removal.'}, {'account_id': 32067, 'date': '2020-08-22 05:27:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> We had some renewed interest in VMWare support, and have not yet
 > decided whether to continue with removal.

ok, and please help review this PS, https://review.opendev.org/#/c/747512/'}, {'account_id': 32067, 'date': '2020-08-22 05:27:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 32067, 'date': '2020-08-24 15:00:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 32067, 'date': '2020-08-24 15:01:19.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to removed-vmware'}, {'account_id': 32067, 'date': '2020-08-24 15:01:54.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from removed-vmware to removed-vmware-supported'}, {'account_id': 28595, 'date': '2020-10-13 19:29:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

We are using this code and are submitting any bug we find on it, but it is pretty straightforward to use and well documented in fact, what is the process to make it un-deprecated ? About CI/CD test we can maybe take a look at minesweeper, the tool used by nova for vmware jobs'}, {'account_id': 32067, 'date': '2020-10-14 00:22:16.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-10-14 08:25:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> We are using this code and are submitting any bug we find on it,
 > but it is pretty straightforward to use and well documented in
 > fact, what is the process to make it un-deprecated ? About CI/CD
 > test we can maybe take a look at minesweeper, the tool used by nova
 > for vmware jobs

Currently VMWare support is in limbo, since we are aware that you are using it. It is deprecated, but we will not remove it for now. We can discuss removing the deprecation in today's IRC meeting."}]

[WIP] Remove VMware integration from kolla-ansible

VMware support has been deprecated[1] and will be removed in the Victoria cycle.

[1]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-February/012646.html

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-08 14:40:14.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie4e8adf4d1e8eb379fc4c8d8aa7e02c4ef411951
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie4e8adf4d1e8eb379fc4c8d8aa7e02c4ef411951

[{'created': '2020-10-12 11:30:32.000000000', 'message': 'Load roles from /usr/share/ansible/roles

For content provider c7 jobs, we need to consume
ansible-role-container-registry role from package which is
installed at /usr/share/ansible/roles. In order to discover
above path, the path needs to be append in ansible.cfg
otherwise it will give role not found.

Change-Id: Ia314e934dadaf05b8aa1e044ea017926efcd53ef
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Load roles from /usr/share/ansible/roles

For content provider c7 jobs, we need to consume
ansible-role-container-registry role from package which is
installed at /usr/share/ansible/roles. In order to discover
above path, the path needs to be append in ansible.cfg
otherwise it will give role not found.

Change-Id: Ia314e934dadaf05b8aa1e044ea017926efcd53ef
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: I0cc7070c971a15873e008a2c6937ce5ac6d24ffa
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Supports for multi_tenant driver of projects using multi-tenant projectId, specified via annotation

driver of multi-tenant project:
multi_tenant = kuryr_kubernetes.controller.drivers.multi_tenant_project:MultiTenantPodProjectDriver
multi_tenant = kuryr_kubernetes.controller.drivers.multi_tenant_project:MultiTenantServiceProjectDriver
multi_tenant = kuryr_kubernetes.controller.drivers.multi_tenant_project:MultiTenantNamespaceProjectDriver
multi_tenant = kuryr_kubernetes.controller.drivers.multi_tenant_project:MultiTenantNetworkPolicyProjectDriver

Implements: blueprint kuryr-multi-tenant-support.
Change-Id: I4fa8e6c5be5f9d41058682611d83162a4346a98a

[{'created': '2020-09-18 21:35:35.000000000', 'message': 'Make permissions tests work

Permissions JS tests are testing promises, however "then" callback functions
aren't called since digest cycles were never triggered. Jasmine Spec Runner
marks them 'passed' only adding "SPEC HAS NO EXPECTATIONS" into their names.
This patch triggers a digest by calling a scope's $apply functions and makes
the tests work.

Partial-Bug: #1894127

Change-Id: I2d13664df42f23f1436f6231fd3cec56475f7e8d
'}, {'created': '2020-09-21 14:01:59.000000000', 'message': 'Make permissions tests work

Permissions JS tests are testing promises, however "then" callback functions
aren't called since digest cycles were never triggered. Jasmine Spec Runner
marks them 'passed' only adding "SPEC HAS NO EXPECTATIONS" into their names.
This patch triggers a digest by calling a scope's $apply functions and makes

Change-Id: I2d13664df42f23f1436f6231fd3cec56475f7e8d
'}]
commit_message:
Make permissions tests work

Permissions JS tests are testing promises, however "then" callback functions
aren't called since digest cycles were never triggered. Jasmine Spec Runner
marks them 'passed' only adding "SPEC HAS NO EXPECTATIONS" into their names.
This patch triggers a digest by calling a scope's $apply functions and makes
the tests work.

Partial-Bug: #1894127

Change-Id: I2d13664df42f23f1436f6231fd3cec56475f7e8d

commit_message:
Nova: Archive/Purge all cell databases

This patch enables --all-cells option in nova db archive/purge command,
to make the command process soft-deleted records in Cell databases.

Change-Id: I4afe15393ab8ea6eb9251dddd1bd211467fe7186
Closes-Bug: #1898508

commit_message:
New proxy logging field for wire status

Capture the on the wire status code for logging because we change the
logged status code sometimes.

Closes-Bug: #1896518
Change-Id: I27feabe923a6520e983637a9c68a19ec7174a0df

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-21 23:40:57.000000000', 'message': "tests: Make test_delete_container_versions less flakey

Hammering that test in a tight loop, I'd often see failures due to
ordering issues. Make the delete single-threaded to avoid that.

Change-Id: Iff45be32a7c3f258214cce78001fd33ad0a39b8c
"}]
commit_message:
tests: Make test_delete_container_versions less flakey

Hammering that test in a tight loop, I'd often see failures due to
ordering issues. Make the delete single-threaded to avoid that.

Change-Id: Iff45be32a7c3f258214cce78001fd33ad0a39b8c

commit_message:
Dep's should be restricted by upper-constraints

Tox trying to install latest versions for building docs which may
not be supported by stable and lower branches, so should be
restricted by respective version's upper-constraints.txt

Change-Id: I65faaf3203ba4be2ceea1168745de4236dc7df53

messages: [{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-09-14 14:59:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2020-10-14 01:39:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-09 17:40:22.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic528f2e22d33b6d674a9369dafb1c297b30f4e38
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic528f2e22d33b6d674a9369dafb1c297b30f4e38

commit_message:
[Ussuri Only] Cleanup workaround for CentOS7

This patch removes some workarounds, which were introduced because of
missing ussuri release on CentOS7 in RDO project, since CentOS7 is
no longer used in beaker tests.

Change-Id: Idbb6a51292c7c238cce808bc467899ab83166971

Expand user path when loading SSL-related files

with this patch the cacert, cert and key items in the clouds.yaml can
have shortened form like "~/.ssl/api.pem"

Change-Id: I3bd12fe0c47a5f373bb231babd260b801a6c411a

subject: DNM: follow-up for Dark Data #35
messages: [{'account_id': 597, 'date': '2020-10-05 21:48:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18142, 'date': '2020-10-09 13:31:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2020-10-14 01:10:29.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nsquashed'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-05 21:48:06.000000000', 'message': "DNM: follow-up for Dark Data #35

The quarantine-on-close is not possible because we're calling
see_object() when df is not open. So, let's leave this alone.
However, I think we might want the following:

 - Do not call other plugins if one plugin forces quarantine.

 - Do not open df if we don't need it open, which is always.

Change-Id: I97e3e86a441c105f71a36cec96da308b70ab3fa5
"}]
commit_message:
DNM: follow-up for Dark Data #35

The quarantine-on-close is not possible because we're calling
see_object() when df is not open. So, let's leave this alone.
However, I think we might want the following:

 - Do not call other plugins if one plugin forces quarantine.

 - Do not open df if we don't need it open, which is always.

Change-Id: I97e3e86a441c105f71a36cec96da308b70ab3fa5

commit_message:
Refactoring: split away continue_node_deploy/clean

To be able to get rid of using RPC for continuing async steps
we need this code to be callable.

Change-Id: I87ec9c39fa00226b196605af97d528b268f304c7

subject: Don't break long/hyphenated words in RST creation
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-13 17:58:54.000000000', 'message': "Don't break long/hyphenated words in RST creation

The textwrap module by default breaks hyphenated words across line
wrapping boundaries, which Sphinx will then reinterpret as
whitespace. Disable this behavior so that hyphenated words will be
moved to the next line rather than broken at their hyphens. Also
disable a related feature which would break lines longer than the
target line length, allowing one-word lines longer than that.

Change-Id: I2ce8dcd4d67b658817857167e218913c75df0bda
"}]
commit_message:
Don't break long/hyphenated words in RST creation

The textwrap module by default breaks hyphenated words across line
wrapping boundaries, which Sphinx will then reinterpret as
whitespace. Disable this behavior so that hyphenated words will be
moved to the next line rather than broken at their hyphens. Also
disable a related feature which would break lines longer than the
target line length, allowing one-word lines longer than that.

Change-Id: I2ce8dcd4d67b658817857167e218913c75df0bda

Sorry, I can't get your point. Can you elaborate it?"}, {'account_id': 25632, 'date': '2017-08-04 03:15:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Sorry, I can't get your point. Can you elaborate it?
Let me clarify why I wanna add --password option.
(1).Sometimes we wanna set a password to a server while creating like nova boot has --admin-pass option.
(2).openstack server rebuild has --password
(3).openstack restapi support set adminPass,description here https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#create-server"}, {'account_id': 22406, 'date': '2017-08-04 03:34:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Sound good, but if you only add parser --password, it doesn't work. Because you don't do anything with `password`. Check [1], should pass password to boot_kwargs - admin_pass=password.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-openstackclient/blob/master/openstackclient/compute/v2/server.py#L769"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-04 04:42:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-12 21:32:26.000000000', 'message': '[Python3] Fix python3 bugs in code

- The BaseException class no longer has a "message"
  attribute in python 3 [1]. On the contrary, the
  string representation of an Exception object will
  print all the exception args in all supported
  python versions, so use that instead.
- Functional tests were run with a specific locale,
  remove those annotations so we can handle unicode
  encoding and decoding in python3 envs.
- Cleanup errors were not being handled correctly,
  cleanup the code so we don't have spurious failures.
- In python3, dict.keys() gives you a view for lazy
  loading, so convert occurrences to lists as expected
  in our functional tests.
- Start capturing STDOUT and STDERR in tox envs to
  enable troubleshooting.

Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1811627
Closes-Bug: #1811516
Change-Id: Idaa2fb9b60451b3fbd298e19574195f2d663c6f4
[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0352/#transition-plan
(cherry picked from commit b955ac9064b15d00e8966dda745814c146c8af01)
'}, {'created': '2020-10-12 21:39:30.000000000', 'message': '[Python3] Fix python3 bugs in code

- The BaseException class no longer has a "message"

- Functional tests were run with a specific locale,

- Cleanup errors were not being handled correctly,
  cleanup the code so we don't have spurious failures.
- In python3, dict.keys() gives you a view for lazy
  loading, so convert occurrences to lists as expected
  in our functional tests.
- Start capturing STDOUT and STDERR in tox envs to
  enable troubleshooting.

Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1811627

commit_message:
[Python3] Fix python3 bugs in code

- The BaseException class no longer has a "message"
  attribute in python 3 [1]. On the contrary, the
  string representation of an Exception object will
  print all the exception args in all supported
  python versions, so use that instead.
- Functional tests were run with a specific locale,
  remove those annotations so we can handle unicode
  encoding and decoding in python3 envs.
- Cleanup errors were not being handled correctly,
  cleanup the code so we don't have spurious failures.
- In python3, dict.keys() gives you a view for lazy
  loading, so convert occurrences to lists as expected
  in our functional tests.
- Start capturing STDOUT and STDERR in tox envs to
  enable troubleshooting.

Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1811627
Closes-Bug: #1811516
Change-Id: Idaa2fb9b60451b3fbd298e19574195f2d663c6f4
[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0352/#transition-plan
(cherry picked from commit b955ac9064b15d00e8966dda745814c146c8af01)
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
